Two.Five:
  "Paano kung hindi mo na talaga kaya?"


STATISTICS



In 2019, WHO reported that
The Philippines had an overall suicide rate of 2.5%,
with 3.9% being men and 1.3% being women.


Whether this amount has increased or not doesn't matter,
losing one person to suicide is hard enough already.

People are here for you.



JUST A REMINDER


It never hurts to call for help. Even if you feel like it's the end of everything for you, please know that people still care for you, you just don't know it.



Though you've probably heard that for way too many times now, I still think there's a meaning to it. I've felt depressed and lonely myself, I feel like we're all on the same boat here.



No person should experience this, ever.



WHO CAN YOU CONTACT?


If you're in the United States, call 1-800-273-TALK (8255), or refer to their website.



In The Philippines


  • Hopeline

    PLDT: (02) 804-4673

    Globe: (0917) 558-4673


  • The National Center for Mental Health Crisis Hotline

    Tel: (02) 989-8727 (Telephone)

    Tel: (0917) 899-8727 (Cellphone)


For a list of more country crisis hotlines, click here.
